data.title: add Strength property to the filter
Sometimes, non-loop MovieClip doesn't dispatch Event.COMPLETE
Setting quad dimension to -1 and back to positive number causes Quad to disappear
Adding filter to parent container crops filters on its children
data.body:
Say I have a sprite bg inside of container thumb. 
I've added a drop shadow to the bg sprite, and then added color matrix filter to the thumb, this will remove the drop shadow on the bg sprite..

data.title: if starling.showStats is set to true before root is created starling.showStats is false
Suggest tweaking Starling.mustAlwaysRender to ignore invisible native children
data.body:
Thing is, native stage children even with visible == false are forcing Starling.mustAlwaysRender to return true. Suggest ignore them when calculating mustAlwaysRender value.
Feather's TextInput uses native stage children for measurements thus forcing Starling to render every frame.

See this issue for details.
# https://github.com/BowlerHatLLC/feathers/issues/1340

data.title: DisplayObject's size with clipRect vs mask - Starling 2.0
data.body:
Previously when using clipRect, the display object's size would update according to the clipRect. Instead of clipRect one should use a mask inStarling 2.0, but unfortunately the display object size is not affected by the mask. Is this on purpose or is this a bug...?

If it's on purpose, how should I get the "masked size" of an object, if the mask is nested somewhere deep in the display object's children...?

data.title: Container's bounds not corresponding with its x,y/width,height
Allow to specify buffer usage for an effect
data.body:
When effect sets up its vertex/index buffers its usage always defaults to 'staticDraw'. Thus, it would be good to have appropriate arguments to specify buffer usage in Effect.uploadVertexData/Effect.uploadIndexData methods.

Something along these lines:

``` actionscript
public function uploadVertexData(vertexData:VertexData, bufferUsage:String = 'staticDraw'):void
public function uploadIndexData(indexData:IndexData, bufferUsage:String = 'staticDraw'):void
```

data.title: Using stylesheets with TextField
data.body:
I had hacked stylesheets into TextField in Starling < 2.0, but now it's a bit more cumbersome with the text compositor.

I understand stylesheets are not for bitmap text, but are there some issues why stylesheets are not enabled for TrueTypeCompositor? After all, it shouldn't be much more than just passing the stylesheet to the native textfield instance, right?

data.body: TextField textBounds.y returns wrong value.

TextField.textBounds returns wrong x/y position when autosized - Starling 2.0

I have button with some kinda border as a child of this button.
When I set filter on this button it cuts borders.
With Starling 1.x it works fine.
https://i.gyazo.com/9e0a218915bdfd7b669bb4566f960d25.gif

data.title: clipRect for Starling 2.0
data.body:
Can we get back clipRect property at least for Image objects? 

Even using quad masks I've got 2 more draw calls for every clipped image.

data.title: Alpha do not work with TextField (Starling 2.0)
Android skipUnchangedFrames
data.body:
When skipUnchangedFrames is enabled and the app is put to the background (followed by a call to Starling.stop(true)) and back to the foreground (followed by a call to Starling.start()) only a black screen is being shown, when the stage contains only static contents. This happens only on Android (tested on a Galaxy S7 with Android 6.0.1).

Calling Starling.setRequiresRedraw immediately after Starling.start() does not work. The call has to be delayed by some ms to make it work.

Perhaps a call to Starling.start() should always result in a redraw being forced?

data.title: Bug in setChildIndex()
Refactoring: Use atan2 instead of atan
data.body:
I've been playing around with Starling lately and noticed this: https://github.com/Gamua/Starling-Framework/blob/master/starling/src/starling/display/DisplayObject.as#L768-L778

I guess (and when I say "guess" i really mean it's a guess, because I'm not an expert here :) you can use a simple atan2() and don't have to check for NaNs and rest of this stuff. Just a suggestion from a guy who knows (almost) nothing about any of this stuff :)

data.title: [Feature] Juggler with a given time interval
data.body:
I was thinking, what if you use a Juggler and sometimes to make sure all tweens added to it finished their execution you call `juggler.advanceTime(1000000)`. After a couple of such calls you'll end up with Juggler's internal time being much greater than the delta-t passed to `advanceTime()` which might lead to lack of precision and tweens to being advanced at all.

I think a solution might be to reset Juggler's internal time once it exceeds a given maximum value (using a simple modulo operation). In most of the cases it's not really relevant what Juggler's internal time is, all it matters if tweens are advanced properly.

Probably adding a `maxInterval` property to Juggler would be a good idea.

data.title: BitmapFont, missing characters display the font name & char
data.body: Linked to #831

data.title: BitmapFont, missing characters display the font name
data.body:
Hi Daniel,

A nicer warning: display the font name in the trace https://github.com/Gamua/Starling-Framework/blob/master/starling/src/starling/text/BitmapFont.as#L313

Sorry for not making a PR but I'm on a 1.8.x project ;-)

data.title: Reuse TouchEvent in the TouchProcessor
data.body:
The TouchEvent is created every time the mouse moves (on a system with a cursor). Maybe it would be good if the TouchEvent is reused to avoid the creation of objects. I tried that by adding a private property in the TouchProcessor and created a TouchEvent in the constructor. I had to set the shiftKey and ctrlKey every time (to do this I removed the getter of them in the TouchEvent and converted the property to a public variable which is much faster anyways). Also I had to reset the _visitedObjects every time.
In the end it all worked :)
Is there a reason to create a new TouchEvent? Am I missing something?

data.title: Per DisplayObject context menus
data.body:
Since the normal Flash player api supports it, might as well see how many starling developers want it.

And yes, Stage3D content should be able to do it. Just need a single listener for the [MouseEvent.CONTEXT_MENU event](http://help.adobe.com/en_US/FlashPlatform/reference/actionscript/3/flash/display/InteractiveObject.html#contextMenu) to switch the menu on the fly just before showing it.

data.title: Distance field fonts
data.body:
As @PrimaryFeather mentioned on #374, Starling might be getting distance field fonts as per [the Valve paper](http://valvesoftware.com/publications/2007/SIGGRAPH2007_AlphaTestedMagnification.pdf).

Might as well formally track this in case @PrimaryFeather has a memory failure.

data.title: Instanced display objects
data.body:
Apparently there is this "instancing" feature on gpus that let you draw the same thing many times in a cheap way.

It looks like the [STANDARD_EXTENDED](http://help.adobe.com/en_US/FlashPlatform/reference/actionscript/3/flash/display3D/Context3DProfile.html#STANDARD_EXTENDED) profile is bringing it to Stage3D and as such, Starling will be able to use it.

data.title: ENTER_FRAME event dispatched twice per frame in a specific situation
Software RenderMode does not support high resolution
data.body:
If you set Starling.supportHighResolutions to true on a high resolution screen, such as a MacBook Retina, while in Software mode you get an exception:

`exception, information=Error: Error #3780: Requested width of backbuffer is not in allowed range 32 to 2048.`

This fix also applies to Starling 1.8.

data.title: Filter setters in Starling 2.0 should be chainable just like in 1.x
data.body:
This code throws an error in 2.0 beta:  
`myFilter = new ColorMatrixFilter().adjustBrightness(-0.5);`

adjustBrightness (and all similar functions in Filters) were returning the Filter instance in Starling 1.x, allowing to easily chain properties.

data.title: Loading ATFs as PMA textures
data.body:
I know Starling handles only PMA textures properly (when using blend modes, etc.), but when loading ATFs they are loaded as non-PMA. BUT it is possible to create an ATF texture with PMA (I'm using JPEGXR compression and `--premultiply-alpha` TexturePacker's option).

I changed this bit in Starling's internals and it works :)

``` as3
public static function fromAtfData(data:ByteArray, scale:Number=1, useMipMaps:Boolean=true,
                                           async:Function=null, repeat:Boolean=false):Texture
(...)
var concreteTexture:ConcreteTexture = new ConcreteTexture(nativeTexture, atfData.format,
    atfData.width, atfData.height, useMipMaps && atfData.numTextures > 1,
    true, false, scale, repeat);
```

My idea is this: add PMA property to `TextureOptions` and use it when loadign ATFs. This way everybody can specify if their ATFs are premultiplied or not.
